data.text:
5/5

Its a 9.5/10 - the .5 was because the distance in location.

I was gifted a night and brunch for my birthday, I paid for an extra night to enjoy my weekend staycation. We stayed in a standard room with golf course view.

All the staff are very accommodating, polite and patient. Raman is very pleasant to speak with.

My friend and I had a few drinks and light bites at Issei, as recommended when we checked in, and Nanette was exceptionally accommodating!

The room is clean, food taste great (both brunch and light bites we had) and the drinks selection are awesome.
data.title: Staycation with  a Golf Course View

Sincerely,
Preet Sandhu,
Assistant Front Office Manager,
Radisson Hotel, Dubai Damac Hills

data.text: Two of the nicest guys roshan and gir have the room looking too too shape but also very kind polite and great customer service !! Everything has been great room smells good kept clean none of my stuff has been messed with over all super nice experience
data.title: To roshan  and gir are the best :)

data.text: I'm thrilled to hear that you've had such a positive experience with the service provided by the team! It's fantastic to know that they consistently go above and beyond to ensure your comfort and satisfaction during your stay. Their friendly and polite demeanor undoubtedly contributes to making your experience even more enjoyable. It's clear that they take pride in their work and are dedicated to providing excellent service. Your kind words will surely be appreciated by the team, and I'm sure they'll continue to strive for excellence in their service delivery. If there's anything else you need during your stay, don't hesitate to let them know—they're here to make your experience as pleasant as possible!
data.title: Thank you to Gir and Roshan

data.text: The hotel was quite quiet when we were there which was great, it meant that there weren’t too many people at breakfast at the same time and it was very pleasant. There is a great choice on offer at breakfast time, and the staff there are so nice. The pancakes are made fresh when you order them and they are amazing, we had them every day they were that good. The day before we left the hotel seemed to get a lot busier, and on our last day we went up to the pool, but it’s not a very big pool and there was no space, but the Easter holidays had started so was busier. Before that day we had used the pool every day and there would only be a handful of people there, wouldn’t like to see it when the hotel is full, but for most of our holiday it was great. We asked about playing golf at the Trump international course which you can walk to as i was told they had preferential rates, we enquired and were told the rates, so went a walk to the course to see what it was like. It looked a good course so we thought we would book when we got back to the hotel, but then the person on the desk said the rates were wrong on where he tried to book, so he gave us new rates which were more than double what was quoted the first time, they are the rates that you would get if you booked yourself, so was a bit disappointed in that, in the end we didn’t book. Apart from that it was a good stay, our room was at a corner so we had a view of the golf course and also the villas that are under construction. There is construction all around the hotel but doesn’t really bother you much, you can hear the reversing beepers on the construction vehicles from about 6.30am but we get up early anyway so was no problem. All in all a nice hotel
data.title: Good hotel

data.text:
Indulge in a symphony of flavors from traditional Arabic delicacies to Global favorites at Radisson Dubai. You'll find variety of main dishes here with refreshing drinks, salad bar, hot & cold appetizers, a live BBQ station & a tempting dessert section.
.
✨️The ambience is infused with spirit of Ramadan, creating an unforgettable dining experience. So, celebrate the blessings of this month with your family prices at AED 175 per person.
data.title: Iftar Buffet with a Vibe
